means: 喜欢( like的过去式和过去分词 )
（与 would 或 should 连用表示客气）想

sentence.Network_en: They would have liked bare wooden floors throughout the house.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们本想在整个房间的木地板上都不铺地毯的。

sentence.Network_en: She would have liked to tell him to butt out.
sentence.Network_cn: 她本想告诉他叫他别插手的。

sentence.Network_en: Ted hated parties, even gatherings of people he liked individually.
sentence.Network_cn: 特德讨厌各种派对，即便是他自己喜欢的人的聚会也不例外。

PerfectNetExp.abs: you like that ? my taddy liked that , too ., 你喜欢吗 ? 我的泰迪也很喜欢.
applauded loudly as they liked the President ' s speech ., 人们热烈鼓掌 , 表示他们非常喜欢总统的讲话.

although we would all love to be Ms Popular home and in the office , at work the task is not to be liked , but to be effective , says computer sales executive Andrea .电脑销售主管安德莉认为，虽然我们都想成为家?或办公室的受欢迎人士，可工作的性质不是要求人们要招人喜爱，而是一定要有工作效率。
then i asked her if she liked chinese music ., 然后我问她喜不喜欢中国音乐.

means.word_mean: 1. found pleasant or attractive; often used as a combining form;

auth_sentence.content: If he liked something, he liked it constantly.
auth_sentence.res_content: If he liked something, he liked it constantly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: If he liked something, he liked it constantly.

auth_sentence.content: I've never liked talking about how I feel.
auth_sentence.res_content: I've never liked talking about how I feel.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I've never liked talking about how I feel.

auth_sentence.content: I've never really liked putting a tie on.
auth_sentence.res_content: I've never really liked putting a tie on.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I've never really liked putting a tie on.

Sentence.sentence: Within the wider business world, a man who liked to see himself as a hippy （嬉皮士）, permanently in revolt against big companies, ended up being hailed by many of those corporate giants as one of the greatest chief executives of his time.
